In response to the Governor’s order for state wide “shelter at home”, Thomas County for the next week will enact the following:

The Public Works and Sanitation staff will be a skeleton crew providing only essential services. The office will be open for phone calls only. Work orders will be made for non-emergency issues and the work completed as soon as staffing permits. All County trash collection sites will remain open 7 days a week from 7:00 a.m. – 7:00 p.m.

This is a very trying time for everyone, but we will get through this. We ask for your utmost patience until we are able to full staff again.

Thomas County road closing April 1 for bridge replacement

Reichertville Road at McKeever Slough Creek in Thomas County is scheduled to close April 1 for replacement of the bridge.

The bridge is located southwest of Boston and was built in 1960. The road will be closed for approximately 75 days.

The bridge replacement is included in a $9.1 million contract that bundles six bridge replacements in the southwest and central areas of the state. The Georgia Department of Transportation awarded the construction contract in 2017 to United Infrastructure Group Inc.

A design-build bridge bundle streamlines and accelerates delivery by combining design and construction and geographically bundling bridges.

post_text:
I would like to thank all the Thomas County Public Works employees for a job well done during Hurricane Irma. Our employees are very seldom recognized for the job they do. We all tend to thank the first responders, EMS, Fire, etc... and they do a great job also. But Public Works departments are generally left out. When it comes to bad weather - thunder storms, tornadoes, hurricanes, etc... Public Works employees are the first responders to get the roads open so that EMS, Fire, Sheriff's Office, etc., can do their job.

Public Works employees will be cleaning up storm debris over the next few weeks. If you see them, please thank them for a job well done!

Tony Bodiford, Director
Thomas County Public Works
